DOC.HEAD: Three Injured in Fire At Texas Nursing Home
With AM-Retirement Home Fire
DOC.TEXT: A fire broke out at a nursing home Sunday, injuring three people and forcing 60 others to move into different rooms, officials said. The blaze started at 7:35 a.m. Firefighters confined the fire to one room, but many others were damaged by smoke and water used to extinguished the blaze. Two residents and a firefighter were treated for smoke inhalation at Arlington Memorial Hospital and released. ``We feel fortunate there were no other injuries, and the Fire Department was quick enough to contain the fire,'' said Gary Anderson, vice president of operations for the nursing home. The cause of the fire has not been determined, officials said.
